toolNaming.style: Tools are referenced by their exact names (e.g., Bash, Read, Edit).
toolNaming.rule: Use the exact tool name. No qualification or prefixes needed.

toolSets.description: Tool set: file system operations (read, write, edit, search).
Tool set: command execution and task management.
Tool set: web fetching and search operations.
Tool set: user interaction and questions.

tools.description: Read file contents from the local filesystem. Supports text files, images, PDFs, and Jupyter notebooks.
tools.notes: Can read any file type. Images and PDFs are processed visually.

tools.description: Create or overwrite files on the local filesystem.
tools.notes: Requires reading the file first if it exists. Prefer Edit for existing files.

tools.description: Perform exact string replacements in existing files.
tools.notes: Requires reading the file first. Fails if old_string is not unique.

tools.description: Execute bash commands in a persistent shell session.
tools.notes: Use for git, npm, docker, etc. Avoid for file operations (use Read/Write/Edit).

tools.description: Find files by glob pattern matching.
tools.notes: Faster than find command. Returns paths sorted by modification time.

tools.description: Search file contents using regular expressions (built on ripgrep).
tools.notes: Supports full regex syntax. Use output_mode for different result formats.

tools.description: Fetch content from a URL and process it with a prompt.
tools.notes: Converts HTML to markdown. Has 15-minute cache.

tools.description: Search the web and return results.
tools.notes: Must include Sources section with URLs after answering.

tools.description: Launch specialized subagents for complex multi-step tasks.
tools.notes: Subagent types: Bash, general-purpose, Explore, Plan, etc.

tools.description: Create and manage a structured task list for tracking progress.
tools.notes: Use for complex multi-step tasks. States: pending, in_progress, completed.

tools.description: Replace, insert, or delete cells in Jupyter notebooks.
tools.notes: Cell numbers are 0-indexed. Supports code and markdown cells.

tools.description: Ask the user questions to gather preferences, clarify instructions, or get decisions.
tools.notes: Supports multiple choice with 2-4 options. Users can always select 'Other'.

tools.description: Retrieve output from a running or completed background task.
tools.notes: Use block=true to wait for completion, block=false for status check.

tools.description: Kill a running background bash shell by its ID.
tools.notes: Use when you need to terminate a long-running shell.

tools.description: Execute a skill (slash command) within the conversation.
Transition to plan mode for designing implementation approaches.
tools.notes: Use for non-trivial implementation tasks requiring user approval.

tools.description: Signal plan completion and request user approval.
tools.notes: Can request bash command permissions via allowedPrompts.
